v.v: Job resumed speaking and said,
“Oh, that I were as I was in the past months
when his lamp shined on my head,
Oh, that I were as I was in the ripeness of my days
when the Almighty was yet with me,
when my way was covered with cream,
When I went out to the city gate,
the young men saw me and kept their distance from me in respect,
The princes used to refrain from talking when I came;
The voices of the noblemen were hushed,
For after their ears heard me, they would then bless me;
because I rescued the one who was poor when he cried out,
The blessing of him who was about to perish came on me;
I put on righteousness, and it clothed me;
I was eyes to blind people;
I was a father to needy people;
I broke the jaws of the unrighteous man;
Then I said, ‘I will die in my nest;
My roots are spread out to the waters,
The honor in me is always fresh,
To me men listened; they waited for me;
After my words were done, they did not speak again;
They always waited for me as they waited for rain;
I smiled on them when they did not expect it;
I selected their way and sat as their chief;

v: when God cared for me,
and when I walked through darkness by his light.
when the friendship of God was on my tent,
and my children were around me,
and the rock poured out for me streams of oil!
when I sat in my place in the city square,
and the aged people rose and stood for me.
they would lay their hand on their mouths.
and their tongue clung to the roof of their mouths.
after their eyes saw me, they would then give witness to me and approve of me
and the one who had no father when he had no one to help him.
I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
my justice was like a robe and a turban.
I was feet to lame people.
I would examine the case even of one whom I did not know.
I plucked the victim out from between his teeth.
I will multiply my days like the grains of sand.
and dew lies all night on my branches.
and the bow of my strength is always new in my hand.’
they stayed silent to hear my advice.
my speech dropped like water on them.
they opened their mouth wide to drink in my words,
as they would do for the latter rain.
they did not reject the light of my face.
I lived like a king in his army,
like one who comforts mourners.
